wikipedia_page.main: Sidney James "Sid" Pugh (10 October 1919 – 15 April 1944) was an English professional footballer who played as a half back.

link_mentions.page: List of footballers killed during World War II
response: * Sidney Pugh – played for Arsenal (1938–1944). Killed in a flying accident training as flying officer in the RAF at Seighford, Staffordshire, on 15 April 1944 aged 24. CWGC casualty record Sidney Pugh.
